0.user_question: The area of Billie's rectangular bedroom is 360 square feet. If the length of his room is 3 yards, what is the perimeter of the room in feet?

ost_step.1: Convert the length from yards to feet (since we want our final answer in feet). We know that 1 yard equals 3 feet so if length=3yd then it would equal(3*3)ft which means Length = 9 ft.
ost_step.2: Since Area = Length x Width , hence you can find width using formula w = Area / Length . Here,w=(Area/Length)=(360sq_feet)/(9ft) Which implies WIDTH=40 sq_feet. To get this value converted back into units as asked for foot unit so divide both sides again by 9 which results further inWIDTH=W/9=((square feet )/(yards))=> ((Square Feet)/9)). This shows us finally,Width=WFD or Foot For Every DeciMeter (as required ). In numerical values; thus Width=40FEET^2/.YDS=.FT..Hence Perimeter=POWER+LEN+POWER+LEN ; POWER being Power Plus One Unit while LENS represents Last Ending Substance i.e., end side quantity used when computing distance around rectangle shape like polygon having four corners but only one angle each corner representing straight line segment ending at same point just forming enclosed space similar to any other such structure including quadrilateral shapes etc. It doesn’t matter whether these figures represent actual buildings made out off earth materials themselves because everything here counts towards getting
ost_step.3: Calculate the perimeter now knowing all dimensions involved. Add up lengths on opposite edges twice since every two consecutive measurements form part circle whose circumference totals itself upon completion until complete loop formation occurs.(Perimeter=LX2+(2xW)+LX2)(where X denotes multiplication sign whereas Numbers nextto them indicate numbers multiplied together respectively.)In general terms,(Circumference C=πD);C=nude circles addedin series wherether nudesareequalsofaroranygivenshapeandsizeofcirclewherradiusisroundedawayfromactualcircularoutlineforconvenience purposesonlywheneverpossibleduringcalculationproceduresusingbasicgeometricalprinciplesetc.).Now applyformulasaboveintoourcurrentscenario:(a)-TofindareaA(b=-Totaldistancearoundrectangleaboverecomputedviaadditionmethodfirstmentionedpreviouslyhere):{A}=\dfrac{(L\times W)}{2}=(\dfrac{9}{2})F=\dfrac{9} {2}\cdot F = \dfrac{9}{2}\cdot SQR_{1}+TRIGONOMETRICDEGREEFORMULA){A}_{=}(LC

direct_answer.text: Firstly, let's convert the length from yards to feet: 3 yds = 3 * 3 = 9 ft. Next, calculate the width using the given area: Width = Area / Length = 360 sq_ft / 9 ft = 40 ft. Finally, compute the perimeter: Perimeter = 2*(length + width) = 2 * (9 ft + 40 ft) = 2 * 49 ft = 98 ft. Therefore, the perimeter of the room is 98 feet. The answer is: 98.

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. 0.user_question: The area of Billie's rectangular bedroom is 360 square feet. If the length of his room is 3 yards, what is the perimeter of the room in feet?

direct_answer.text: Firstly, let us convert the measurements into one unit (feet). We know that 1 yard equals 3 feet. Therefore, if the length of the room is 3 yards, it would equal \(3 \text{ yd} \times 3 \frac{\text{ft}}{\text{yd}} = 9 \text{ ft}\). To find the width (\(w\)) we can use the formula for the area of a rectangle which is \(\text{Area} = \text{length} \times \text{width}\), hence \(360 \text{ sq ft} = 9 \text{ ft} \times w\). Solving for \(w\) yields \(w = \frac{360}{9} = 40 \text{ ft}\). Next, knowing both dimensions allows us to calculate the perimeter using the following equation: Perimeter \(P = 2(\text{length}) + 2(\text{width})\), so substituting our values results in \(P = 2(9) + 2(40)\), simplifying further leads to \(P = 18 + 80\), thus yielding \(P = 98 \

0.user_question: The area of Billie's rectangular bedroom is 360 square feet. If the length of his room is 3 yards, what is the perimeter of the room in feet?

1.subquestion: Convert the length from yards to feet first because our final unit should be measured in feet. There are 3 feet in one yard. Thus if Length (L) equals 3 yards then converting will give us an equivalent value i.e., multiplying 3 yds x 3ft=9 ft.

subanswer.text: We know that Area(A) = Length(L)*Breadth(B). Here A=360 sq.feet & L=9 feet. As such B=(A)/L or equal to 360sq.feet divided by 9 feet equating to 40 Feet. Hence now considering both dimensions calculated; Perimeter would sum up all sides hence P=[2*Length+2*breadth] thus yielding [2*(9)+2*40]= 98Feet. Answer :  98 feet .

direct_answer.text: Firstly we need to convert the length from yards to feet as mentioned above since it was asked to find out the measurements in feet only. This means 3 yards become 3x3 which amounts to 9 feet. To compute the breadth you can use this formula derived from knowing area calculation methods: b=a/l so here its 360 feet / 9 feet resulting into 40 feet breadth. Finally calculate the perimeter using these converted values: p=2*length + 2*breadth therefore substituting obtained lengths results in 2*9 feet + 2*40 feet amounting to 98 feet. Final

0.user_question: The area of Billie's rectangular bedroom is 360 square feet. If the length of his room is 3 yards, what is the perimeter of the room in feet?

1.subquestion: Convert the length from yards to feet first because our final unit should be measured in feet. There are 3 feet in one yard. Thus if Length (L) equals 3 yards then converting will give us an equivalent value i.e., multiplying 3 yds x 3ft=9 ft.

subanswer.text: We know that Area(A) = Length(L)*Breadth(B). Here A=360 sq.feet & L=9 feet. As such B=(A)/L or equal to 360sq.feet divided by 9 feet equating to 40 Feet. Hence now considering both dimensions calculated; Perimeter would sum up all sides hence P=[2*Length+2*breadth] thus yielding [2*(9)+2*40]= 98Feet. Answer :  98 feet .

subanswer.text: Billie’s Rectangle Bedroom Area Problem Step By Step Solution Let's assume 'W' as width & 'L' as length which we need to convert into foot measure before applying formula. We know Formular : Area (A)= Width(W)*Length(L). Given , W*L=360 sq.feet . PL=(P/2)*(L+W),          [wherein I denote Perimeter]    
   AL=LxW             [area denoted henceforth],      -- Equation[E1]=360                       ;            And since Plans equal twice the Summation of parallel side lengths =>        
P=2(L+W)              ---Equation E2                --> thus dividing equatiopn E1 & E2 yields;       
AL=[Pl/2]*[(l)+(w)]===>2lw=----------------> simplifying further this equation becomes -> W=(-Al)/2l               ----equation E3           {solving it out}   ..so substituting value back in original eqtn E1
